abstracts.cdata!:
Project ratings convey satisfactory
            outcomes, sustainability, and performances by both the Bank
            and Borrower, with substantial institutional development
            impacts. This simplified Implementation Completion Report
            conveys the following findings and implications for
            subsequent operations. A stable political environment
            contributed to the continued, successful implementation of
            macroeconomic and structural reforms in Vietnam. Building a
            broad-based consensus and strong government commitment
            through the preparation of the Comprehensive Poverty
            Reduction and Growth Strategy (CPRGS), minimized the risky
            (and potential) erosion of political support, and the
            likelihood of policy reversals due to political changes. The
            availability of technical assistance grants from donors, and
            strong and close Bank team support, plays a key role in
            low-income countries with weak technical working level
            capacity, especially in reforms in the State-owned
            enterprises (SOE), and banking sectors. The continued
            efforts within such coordination, proved successful in both
            project design and implementation.
